bibl.title: A Companion to Greco-Roman and Late Antique Egypt.
bibl.seg: Katelijn Vandorpe (ed.), A Companion to Greco-Roman and Late Antique Egypt = Blackwell Companions to the Ancient World.
Hoboken, NJ, Wiley, 2019, xxxviii-751 pp., figg. ISBN 978-1-118-42847-4. $210.

Pp. xxi-xxiii: Preface (K.V.). - 39 contributions. - Part I. Greco-Roman Egypt Explored. - Part II. Egypt as Part of a Globalizing World. - Part III. Governing a Country with a Past: Between Tradition and Innovation. - Part IV. Developing the Economic Strength of the Nile Country. - Part V. Identity in a Multicultural Environment. - Part VI. Traditional Religious Life Challenged. - Part VII. Creative Minds in Theory and Praxis. - Part VIII. Epilogue. - Digital Resources. Bibliography. Index.
